etymology.description: 送(送) (sòng, "send") + 秋波(秋波) (qiūbō, "autumn wave")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 送秋波 (sòng qiūbō) metaphorically means to cast amorous glances. 秋波(秋波) (qiūbō, "autumn wave") refers to the soft and gentle look in one's eyes, evoking the idea of a calm autumn scene or a gentle wave, often used in poetry to describe a flirtatious or enchanting gaze. By combining it with 送(送) (sòng, "send"), it creates the meaning of sending or directing such gazes toward someone.

parts.english: send; deliver; give as a gift; see off

examples.chinese: 她在晚会中送秋波(她在晚會中送秋波)，让他心动(讓他心動)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài wǎnhuì zhōng sòng qiūbō, ràng tā xīndòng.
examples.english: She cast amorous glances during the party, making his heart flutter.

examples.chinese: 帅哥见到她便送秋波(帥哥見到她便送秋波)，悄悄表达心意(悄悄表達心意)。
examples.pinyin: Shuài gē jiàn dào tā biàn sòng qiūbō, qiāoqiāo biǎodá xīnyì.
examples.english: The handsome guy, upon seeing her, cast amorous glances, subtly expressing his feelings.

examples.chinese: 在音乐会间隙，他悄悄送秋波(在音樂會間隙，他悄悄送秋波)，引起了她的注意(引起了她的注意)。
examples.pinyin: Zài yīnyuèhuì jiànxì, tā qiāoqiāo sòng qiūbō, yǐnqǐ le tā de zhùyì.
examples.english: During the intermission of the concert, he quietly cast amorous glances, catching her attention.
